revised_title: Effects of Beta Rays from Radium on Cancer Cell Growth and Division
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the effects of beta rays from radium on the growth and division of cancer cells. They found that a lethal dose of beta rays could prevent cancer cells from growing when transplanted into normal susceptible rats. The study showed that cells are most susceptible to radiation when they are in a state of division. The results suggest that radiation therapy can temporarily prevent cancer cells from dividing, which may help in treating cancer.
